subject: Re: How do I change the timezone used for the timestamp in the XML formatter?
msgSnippet: Steve, Search for timestamp in the Ant stylesheets (located in Ant s etc folder). That is the place where the date/time is wtrittrn to your html doc. Try to
messageBody:
Steve,

Search for timestamp in the Ant stylesheets (located in Ant's etc
folder). That is the place where the date/time is wtrittrn to your
html doc.

Try to convert it to your timezone using the function fn:adjust-
dateTime-to-timezone(datetime,timezone), documented on
http://www.w3schools.com/xpath/xpath_functions.asp

Regards, Jan

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains762@...>
wrote:
>
> lrdvadersith wrote:
>
> > Currently, when I run JUnit 4 tests using the XML formatter, it
puts a
> > timestamp in each of the xml files. The problem is, it's the wrong
> > time. I would like to use my local time instead of Zulu time. Is
> > there a way to do this in my build.xml file?
> >
> > The TSTMP and TODAY values have my local time.
> >
> > Any ideas?
>
> I don't remember enough XSL to know whether you can do that with
XSL. If
> you can, then just change the stylesheet Ant's <junit> formatter
uses.
> Google will give you the code-level details.
> --
> J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
> Your guide to software craftsmanship
> JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
> 2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
>
